alert.note: Alert for Coastal Duval; Coastal St. Johns; Eastern Clay; Eastern Putnam; Inland St. Johns; South Central Duval; Western Clay; Western Putnam (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Jacksonville (Northeast Florida and Southeast Georgia)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 17 at 5:48PM EDT by NWS Jacksonville
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of St. Johns, northeastern Putnam, central Clay and southeastern Duval Counties through 715 PM EDT... Strong to isolated severe storms are expected through 715 pm from eastern Clay and Putnam counties to the St. Johns River basin. These storms will intensify quickly and move east at 15 mph. Those from the St. Johns River basin south of the Buckman Bridge to Palatka and extending toward the Atlantic coast from Ponte Vedra Beach to Crescent Beach should prepare for strong storms and may wish to seek safe shelter until storms pass. HAZARD...Wind gusts 40 to 50 mph, excessive cloud-to-ground lightning, and minor flooding due to heavy rainfall. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Excessive cloud-to-ground lightning is occurring. Minor flooding due to heavy rainfall is possible. Locations impacted include... Saint Augustine, Palatka, Orange Park, Green Cove Springs, Hastings, East Palatka, Unf, Mandarin, Fruit Cove and Middleburg. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. For boaters on or near the St Johns River or Intracoastal waterway, move to a safe shelter now! Do not be caught on or near the water. Gusty winds and choppy waves are likely. Make sure all on board are wearing life jackets.

area.areaDesc: Coastal Duval; Coastal St. Johns; Eastern Clay; Eastern Putnam; Inland St. Johns; South Central Duval; Western Clay; Western Putnam
